peppers.name: Pili pili
peppers.description: A small, vibrantly colored hot pepper.

peppers.name: Jalapeño
peppers.description: A medium-sized chili pepper with a mild heat.

peppers.name: Serrano
peppers.description: A small, green chili pepper with a sharp bite.

peppers.name: Habanero
peppers.description: A fiery hot pepper with a fruity flavor.

peppers.name: Bell Pepper
peppers.description: A large, sweet pepper available in various colors.

peppers.name: Poblano
peppers.description: A mild chili pepper, often used in Mexican cuisine.

peppers.name: Anaheim
peppers.description: A mild, slightly sweet pepper used in various dishes.

peppers.name: Cayenne
peppers.description: A long, red pepper known for its intense heat.

peppers.name: Cherry Pepper
peppers.description: A small, round pepper with a tangy flavor.

peppers.name: Shishito
peppers.description: A small, wrinkled pepper that is sweet with occasional heat.

peppers.name: Padron
peppers.description: A Spanish pepper known for its unpredictable heat.

peppers.name: Jaloro
peppers.description: A yellow variant of the jalapeño with a mild, fruity flavor.

peppers.name: Banana Pepper
peppers.description: A tangy, yellow pepper that’s great for pickling.

peppers.name: Fresno Pepper
peppers.description: A red pepper similar to the jalapeño but with a slightly different flavor.

peppers.name: Thai Bird Chili
peppers.description: A small, fiery pepper commonly used in Thai cuisine.

peppers.name: Scotch Bonnet
peppers.description: A pepper with a fruity, sweet flavor and intense heat, often used in Caribbean dishes.

peppers.name: Hungarian Wax Pepper
peppers.description: A yellow pepper with a waxy skin and a hot, tangy flavor.

peppers.name: Caribbean Red Habanero
peppers.description: An extremely hot pepper with a rich, fruity flavor.

peppers.name: Carolina Reaper
peppers.description: One of the hottest peppers in the world! The flavor is fruity and similar to a 7 Pot chili pepper.

peppers.name: Ghost Pepper
peppers.description: The ghost pepper (aka the Bhut Jolokia) is one of the hottest peppers in the world. Ripe peppers measure 2.5 to 3.3 inches long and are usually red, though there are red, yellow, orange, white, purple or chocolate color varieties. They originate in Northern India and the peppers have been around for generations, though only cultivated in the western world since the turn of the century.
